instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRG: What is ALL_SYS_PWRG? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWRG, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Got this board. All s5 rails are present. No water damage. Just stopped working.


<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRG</SIGNAL> is 0V. When i connect magsafe fan doesnt spin but board pulses all s0 rails for a second than stays in s5 state.

In SMC bypass fan spin and stop twice and than nothing happens.


The only rail not present when plug is  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> (pulsing twice to 5V and goes to 0). Already checked and changed <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> with no result


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Mnay times, two pulses is just sign of bad CPU.
You should start checking all SPI Bus Termination resistors and traces.
Also try known good BIOS.

Do you get pulse at <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>   pulses twice and stays 0. Bad CPU?


SPI Bus Termination resistors and traces.( will check this but i think it's waste of time)
